unit_learning_outcomes.description: explore the academic and professional literatures relating the selected issue;
effectively communicate these things to academic and professional audiences.
identify an issue that is central to some aspect of educational theory, policy or practice;
organise, analyse and synthesise the available research and scholarship so as to describe what is known about the issue;
adopt, an evidence based position in relation to the issue;

assessments.description: In consultation with their supervisor, each student develops a learning contract that includes: the topic and learning objectives of the project; strategies, resources, and learning activities the student will employ to fulfil the learning objectives of the project; assessment tasks, descriptions, weightings, and due dates; an assessment rubric for each task.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Fully online/virtual
Session 2, Fully online/virtual
Session 3, Fully online/virtual
data.description: This unit offers a flexible program of postgraduate study for educational studies students. The unit will generally be developed as a guided reading unit in which students will work with an academic supervisor to produce a number of assessable tasks relevant to a field of theory, policy, or practice. The unit offers students an opportunity to further develop their critical thinking and research skills, as well as knowledge of their chosen topic.
data.title: Independent Education Project
